page.title: 08FARMING IN HAMPEN
page.content: Hampen Manor Farm belonged to the same family for 200 years.The present owner farms 80 hectares,two thirds used for cereals,the other third for pasturing sheep and beef cattle. He claims that he and neighbouring land owners have planted more trees during the past 10years than were planted in the previous two hundered. He owns two or three fields with lynchetts,or mediaval terraces once used for cultivation.This land is too steep for present day ploughing so the lynchetts are left undisturbed.Now overgrown with grass,they provide excellent tobogganing for the family.
